attributes.action: abolish private companies the right to offer to wheel clamp on private land in England
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In Scotland, in 1992, wheel-clamping on private land was banned overnight. It was declared to be extortion and theft. Many clampers don’t have offices and work from PO Box addresses or from mobile phones. Charges can range from around £50 to over £500 for the removal of clamps and towing away fees. England should not be subject to these unjust extortions just because it is unable to get individual representation in the UK Parliment, therefore I urge the Prime Minister to bring about discussion of the abolishment of private clamping companies in England and/or the UK as a whole.
